plastic.英释: a light strong material that is produced by a chemical process, and which can be made into different shapes when it is soft

clutter.英释: to cover or fill a space or room with too many things, so that it looks very untidy

surmise.英释: If you say that a particular conclusion is surmise, you mean that it is a guess based on the available evidence and you do not know for certain that it is true

dynamic.英释: something that causes action or change

pervade.英释: if a feeling, idea, or smell pervades a place, it is present in every part of it

caustic.中释: [助剂] 腐蚀剂；苛性钠；焦散曲线

rectify.英释: If you rectify something that is wrong, you change it so that it becomes correct or satisfactory

suspend.中释: 延缓，推迟；使暂停；使悬浮
suspend.英释: to officially stop something from continuing, especially for a short time

salvage.英释: to save something from an accident or bad situation in which other things have already been damaged, destroyed, or lost

gourmet.英释: Gourmet food is nicer or more unusual or sophisticated than ordinary food, and is often more expensive

seminar.英释: a class at a university or college for a small group of students and a teacher to study or discuss a particular subject

disturb.中释: 打扰；妨碍；使不安；弄乱；使恼怒
disturb.英释: to interrupt someone so that they cannot continue what they are doing

quantum.中释: 量子论；额；美国昆腾公司（世界领先的硬盘生产商）
quantum.英释: a unit of energy in nuclear physics

bravado.英释: behaviour that is deliberately intended to make other people believe you are brave and confident

aqueous.英释: containing water or similar to water

travail.中释: 辛勤努力；经受分娩的阵痛

brittle.中释: 易碎的，脆弱的；易生气的

exhaust.英释: a pipe on a car or machine that waste gases pass through

amateur.英释: Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job

sealant.英释: a substance that is put on the surface of something to protect it from air, water etc

subside.英释: if a feeling, pain, sound etc subsides, it gradually becomes less and then stops

element.中释: 元素；要素；原理；成分；自然环境
element.英释: one part or feature of a whole system, plan, piece of work etc, especially one that is basic or important

ascetic.英释: An ascetic is someone who is ascetic

dissect.英释: to examine something carefully in order to understand it

cathode.英释: the negative  electrode  , marked (-), from which an electric current leaves a piece of equipment such as a  battery

turmoil.英释: a state of confusion, excitement, or anxiety

mandate.英释: to give someone the right or power to do something

trivial.中释: 不重要的，琐碎的；琐细的

epitaph.英释: a short piece of writing on the stone over someone’s grave(= place in the ground where someone is buried )

cognate.英释: a word in one language that has the same origin as a word in another language

winsome.中释: 迷人的；可爱的；引人注目的
winsome.英释: behaving in a pleasant and attractive way

convoke.英释: to tell people that they must come together for a formal meeting

codicil.英释: a document making a change or addition to a  will (= a legal document saying who you want your money and property to go to when you die )

calorie.英释: a unit for measuring the amount of  energy  that food will produce

nemesis.中释: 报应；给与惩罚的人；天罚
nemesis.英释: a punishment that is deserved and cannot be avoided

penalty.英释: a punishment for breaking a law, rule, or legal agreement

analyst.中释: 分析者；精神分析医师；分解者
analyst.英释: someone whose job is to think about something carefully in order to understand it, and often to advise other people about it

furtive.英释: behaving as if you want to keep something secret

defiant.中释: 挑衅的；目中无人的，蔑视的；挑战的
defiant.英释: If you say that someone is defiant, you mean they show aggression or independence by refusing to obey someone

imitate.英释: to copy the way someone behaves, speaks, moves etc, especially in order to make people laugh

tangent.英释: a straight line that touches the outside of a curve but does not cut across it

violent.英释: involving actions that are intended to injure or kill people, by hitting them, shooting them etc

brigand.英释: a thief, especially one of a group that attacks people in mountains or forests

slander.英释: a false spoken statement about someone, intended to damage the good opinion that people have of that person

despoil.英释: to steal from a place or people using force, especially in a war

nonplus.英释: to put at a loss; confound

charter.英释: a statement of the principles, duties, and purposes of an organization

distend.英释: to swell or make something swell because of pressure from inside

vitiate.英释: to make something less effective or spoil it

heedful.中释: 注意的；深切注意的；深切留心的

sarcasm.英释: a way of speaking or writing that involves saying the opposite of what you really mean in order to make an unkind joke or to show that you are annoyed

fretful.中释: 焦躁的；烦燥的；起波纹的
fretful.英释: If someone is fretful, they behave in a way that shows that they are worried or unhappy about something

belabor.中释: 痛打；抨击；过度说明；反复讨论

obviate.英释: to prevent or avoid a problem or the need to do something

condone.英释: to accept or forgive behaviour that most people think is morally wrong

deplore.中释: 谴责；悲悼；哀叹；对…深感遗憾
deplore.英释: to disapprove of something very strongly and criticize it severely, especially publicly

elusive.中释: 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的
elusive.英释: an elusive result is difficult to achieve

methane.中释: [有化] 甲烷；[能源] 沼气
methane.英释: a gas that you cannot see or smell, which can be burned to give heat

disdain.英释: to have no respect for someone or something, because you think they are not important or good enough

surfeit.中释: 使饮食过度；使厌腻；使过度沉溺于

espouse.英释: to support an idea, belief etc, especially a political one

residue.英释: a substance that remains on a surface, in a container etc and cannot be removed easily, or that remains after a chemical process

fervent.中释: 热心的；强烈的；炽热的；热烈的
fervent.英释: believing or feeling something very strongly and sincerely

mundane.中释: 世俗的，平凡的；世界的，宇宙的
mundane.英释: ordinary and not interesting or exciting

arrange.英释: to organize or make plans for something such as a meeting, party, or trip

agitate.英释: to shake or mix a liquid quickly

pungent.中释: 辛辣的；刺激性的；刺鼻的；苦痛的；尖刻的
pungent.英释: having a strong taste or smell

mordent.英释: a melodic ornament consisting of the rapid alternation of a note with a note one degree lower than it

retrace.英释: to repeat exactly the same journey that someone else has made

artless.中释: 天真的；朴实的；无虚饰的

eclipse.英释: an occasion when the sun or the moon cannot be seen, because the Earth is passing directly between the moon and the sun, or because the moon is passing directly between the Earth and the sun

immerse.英释: to put someone or something deep into a liquid so that they are completely covered

bailiff.中释: 法警；执行官；区镇的地方长官
bailiff.英释: an official of the legal system who watches prisoners and keeps order in a court of law

chateau.中释: （法国封建时代的）城堡；（尤指法国的）别墅

formula.中释: [数] 公式，准则；配方；婴儿食品
formula.英释: a method or set of principles that you use to solve a problem or to make sure that something is successful

inhuman.中释: 残忍的；野蛮的；无人性的
inhuman.英释: very cruel or without any normal feelings of pity

disavow.中释: 否认，否定；抵赖；拒绝对…的责任
disavow.英释: to say that you are not responsible for something, that you do not know about it, or that you are not involved with it

preface.英释: If you preface an action or speech with something else, you do or say this other thing first

cadenza.英释: a difficult part of a long piece of music, which a performer plays alone in order to show his or her skill

stealth.英释: when you do something very quietly, slowly or secretly, so that no one notices you

acclaim.英释: Acclaim is public praise for someone or something

giraffe.英释: a tall African animal with a very long neck and legs and dark spots on its yellow-brown fur

integer.中释: [数] 整数；整体；完整的事物

glimpse.英释: to see someone or something for a moment without getting a complete view of them

cession.中释: （权利的）转让，出让；（领土的）割让
cession.英释: the act of giving up land, property, or rights, especially to another country after a war, or something that is given up in this way

retouch.英释: to improve a picture or photograph by painting over marks or making other small changes

warrant.英释: to promise that something is true

haggard.英释: a hawk that has reached maturity before being caught

mystify.中释: 使神秘化；使迷惑，使困惑
mystify.英释: if something mystifies you, it is so strange or confusing that you cannot understand or explain it

insulin.英释: a substance produced naturally by your body which allows sugar to be used for energy

trammel.英释: a hindrance to free action or movement

peevish.中释: 易怒的，暴躁的；带怒气的；撒娇的
peevish.英释: easily annoyed by small and unimportant things

forsake.英释: to stop doing, using, or having something that you enjoy

bizarre.中释: 奇异的（指态度，容貌，款式等）

retinue.英释: a group of people who travel with someone important to help and support them

embrace.英释: the act of holding someone close to you, especially as a sign of love

inhibit.英释: to prevent something from growing or developing well

emotion.英释: a strong human feeling such as love, hate, or anger

pollute.英释: to make air, water, soil etc dangerously dirty and not suitable for people to use

colloid.英释: a mixture having particles of one component, with diameters between 10–7 and 10–9 metres, suspended in a continuous phase of another component

ductile.中释: 柔软的；易教导的；易延展的
ductile.英释: ductile metals can be pressed or pulled into shape without needing to be heated

erratic.中释: 漂泊无定的人；古怪的人

overlap.中释: 部分重叠；部分的同时发生
overlap.英释: If one thing overlaps another, or if you overlap them, a part of the first thing occupies the same area as a part of the other thing. You can also say that two things overlap.

premise.中释: 前提；上述各项；房屋连地基
premise.英释: the buildings and land that a shop, restaurant, company etc uses

academy.中释: 学院；研究院；学会；专科院校
academy.英释: an official organization which encourages the development of literature, art, science etc

release.英释: when someone is officially allowed to go free, after being kept somewhere

erosion.英释: the process by which rock or soil is gradually destroyed by wind, rain, or the sea

adverse.中释: 不利的；相反的；敌对的（名词adverseness，副词adversely）

poverty.英释: the situation or experience of being poor

granule.英释: a small hard piece of something

bauxite.中释: 矾土，[矿物] 铁铝氧石；[矿物] 铝土矿
bauxite.英释: a soft substance that  aluminium  is obtained from

divisor.英释: the number by which another number is to be divided

wistful.中释: 渴望的；沉思的，默想的；引起怀念的；不满足似的
wistful.英释: thinking sadly about something you would like to have but cannot have, especially something that you used to have in the past

acidify.英释: to become an acid or make something become an acid

calumny.英释: when someone says things like this

absence.英释: when you are not in the place where people expect you to be, or the time that you are away

swindle.英释: to get money from someone by deceiving them

succumb.英释: to stop opposing someone or something that is stronger than you, and allow them to take control

mixture.英释: a combination of two or more different things, feelings, or types of people

viceroy.中释: 总督；（北美）一种黑色蝴蝶
viceroy.英释: a man who was sent by a king or queen in the past to rule another country

hormone.英释: a chemical substance produced by your body that influences its growth, development, and condition

drought.英释: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

cherish.英释: if you cherish something, it is very important to you

austere.中释: 严峻的；简朴的；苦行的；无装饰的
austere.英释: plain and simple and without any decoration

preempt.中释: 先占；先取；以先买权获得

pageant.中释: 盛会；游行；虚饰；露天表演

narrate.英释: to tell a story by describing all the events in order, for example in a book

fission.中释: 裂变；分裂；分体；分裂生殖法
fission.英释: the process of splitting an atom to produce large amounts of energy or an explosion

ominous.英释: making you feel that something bad is going to happen

nascent.中释: 初期的；开始存在的，发生中的
nascent.英释: coming into existence or starting to develop

organic.中释: [有化] 有机的；组织的；器官的；根本的
organic.英释: living, or produced by or from living things

distort.英释: to report something in a way that is not completely true or correct

corrupt.英释: to encourage someone to start behaving in an immoral or dishonest way

carnage.英释: when a lot of people are killed and injured, especially in a war

risible.中释: 可笑的；爱笑的；引人笑的
risible.英释: something that is risible is so stupid that it deserves to be laughed at

irksome.中释: 令人厌烦的，讨厌的；令人厌恶的

episode.中释: 插曲；一段情节；插话；有趣的事件
episode.英释: a television or radio programme that is one of a series of programmes in which the same story is continued each week

concede.英释: to admit that something is true or correct, although you wish it were not true

profuse.中释: 丰富的；很多的；慷慨的；浪费的
profuse.英释: produced or existing in large quantities

foliate.中释: 有叶的；叶状的；成薄片的
foliate.英释: relating to, possessing, or resembling leaves

subsist.英释: to stay alive when you only have small amounts of food or money

stipend.中释: 奖学金；固定薪金；定期津贴；养老金
stipend.英释: an amount of money paid regularly to someone, especially a priest, as a salary or as money to live on

servile.中释: 奴隶的；奴性的；卑屈的；卑屈的
servile.英释: very eager to obey someone because you want to please them – used to show disapproval

dissent.英释: refusal to agree with an official decision or accepted opinion

sleight.中释: 手法，技巧；熟练，灵巧；诡计

perturb.中释: 扰乱；使…混乱；使…心绪不宁
perturb.英释: If something perturbs you, it worries you quite a lot

immoral.中释: 不道德的；邪恶的；淫荡的

lunatic.英释: someone who behaves in a crazy or very stupid way – often used humorously

gesture.英释: to move your hand, arm, or head to tell someone something, or show them what you mean

prodigy.中释: 奇迹，奇事；奇才；奇观；预兆
prodigy.英释: A prodigy is someone young who has a great natural ability for something such as music, mathematics, or sports

premier.英释: a  prime minister  – used in news reports

literal.中释: 文字的；逐字的；无夸张的
literal.英释: The literal sense of a word or phrase is its most basic sense

falsify.中释: 伪造；篡改；歪曲；证明虚假
falsify.英释: to change figures, records etc so that they contain false information

wavelet.英释: Wavelets are small waves on the surface of a sea or lake

verdict.英释: an official decision made in a court of law, especially about whether someone is guilty of a crime or how a death happened

divulge.英释: to give someone information that should be secret

spinous.中释: 刺状的；多刺的；尖尖的；难弄的

gratify.英释: to make someone feel pleased and satisfied

rupture.英释: to break or burst, or to make something break or burst

enchant.英释: In fairy tales and legends, to enchant someone or something means to put a magic spell on them

precise.英释: precise information, details etc are exact, clear, and correct

discern.英释: If you can discern something, you are aware of it and know what it is

devalue.英释: to reduce the value of one country’s money when it is exchanged for another country’s money

annuity.中释: 年金，养老金；年金保险；年金享受权
annuity.英释: a fixed amount of money that is paid each year to someone, usually until they die

incubus.英释: someone or something that causes a lot of worries or problems

oratory.英释: the skill of making powerful speeches

avidity.英释: the quality or state of being avid

eternal.英释: continuing for ever and having no end

suffuse.英释: if warmth, colour, liquid etc suffuses something or someone, it covers or spreads through them

involve.中释: 包含；牵涉；使陷于；潜心于
involve.英释: if an activity or situation involves something, that thing is part of it or a result of it

reagent.英释: a substance that shows that another substance in a  compound  exists, by causing a chemical  reaction

fortify.中释: 加强；增强；（酒）的酒精含量；设防于
fortify.英释: to encourage an attitude or feeling and make it stronger

nullify.英释: to make something lose its effect or value

abscond.英释: to escape from a place where you are being kept

pointer.英释: something that shows how a situation is developing, or is a sign of what might happen in the future

bulbous.中释: 球根的；球根状的；由球根生长的（等于bulbaceous）

legible.中释: 清晰的；易读的；易辨认的
legible.英释: written or printed clearly enough for you to read

exclude.中释: 排除；排斥；拒绝接纳；逐出

glimmer.英释: to shine with a light that is not very bright

subvert.英释: to try to destroy the power and influence of a government or the established system

piteous.英释: expressing suffering and sadness in a way that makes you feel pity

tribute.中释: 礼物；[税收] 贡物；颂词；（尤指对死者的）致敬，悼念，吊唁礼物
tribute.英释: something that you say, do, or give in order to express your respect or admiration for someone

despair.英释: to feel that there is no hope at all

outlast.英释: to continue to exist or be effective for a longer time than something else

nominee.中释: 被任命者；被提名的人；代名人
nominee.英释: someone who has been officially suggested for an important position, duty, or prize

outlive.中释: 比…活得长；比…经久；经受住；渡过…而存在
outlive.英释: to remain alive after someone else has died

vacuous.中释: 空的；空虚的；空洞的；无意义的
vacuous.英释: showing no intelligence or having no useful purpose

tantrum.英释: a sudden short period when someone, especially a child, behaves very angrily and unreasonably

complex.英释: a large number of things which are closely related

reptile.英释: a type of animal, such as a snake or  lizard  , whose body temperature changes according to the temperature around it, and that usually lays eggs to have babies

repress.英释: if someone represses upsetting feelings, memories etc, they do not allow themselves to express or think about them

relapse.中释: 复发，再发；故态复萌；回复原状
relapse.英释: when someone becomes ill again after having seemed to improve

audible.英释: a sound that is audible is loud enough for you to hear it

nucleon.英释: a proton or neutron, esp one present in an atomic nucleus

dignify.中释: 使高贵；增威严；授以荣誉

prolong.英释: to deliberately make something such as a feeling or an activity last longer

refugee.中释: 难民，避难者；流亡者，逃亡者
refugee.英释: someone who has been forced to leave their country, especially during a war, or for political or religious reasons

autopsy.中释: 验尸；[病理][特医] 尸体解剖；[病理][特医] 尸体剖检
autopsy.英释: an examination of a dead body to discover the cause of death

glucose.英释: a natural form of sugar that exists in fruit

refract.英释: if glass or water refracts light, the light changes direction when it passes through the glass or water

alcohol.英释: drinks such as beer or wine that contain a substance which can make you drunk

trestle.中释: [交] 栈桥，高架桥；支架，搁凳
trestle.英释: an A-shaped frame used as one of the two supports for a temporary table

prelude.中释: 成为…的序幕；演奏…作为前奏曲

tedious.英释: something that is tedious continues for a long time and is not interesting

tarnish.中释: 玷污；使……失去光泽；使……变灰暗
tarnish.英释: if an event or fact tarnishes someone’s  reputation  , record, image etc, it makes it worse

factual.英释: based on facts or relating to facts

geology.英释: the study of the rocks, soil etc that make up the Earth, and of the way they have changed since the Earth was formed

stratum.中释: （组织的）层；[地质] 地层；社会阶层
stratum.英释: a layer of rock or earth

engrave.英释: to cut words or designs on metal, wood, glass etc

mollify.中释: 平息，缓和；使…平静；使…变软
mollify.英释: to make someone feel less angry and upset about something

auspice.英释: a sign or omen, esp one that is favourable

boycott.英释: an act of boycotting something, or the period of time when it is boycotted

rescind.英释: to officially end a law, or change a decision or agreement

citadel.英释: a strong  fort (= small castle )  built in the past as a place where people could go for safety if their city was attacked

immense.中释: 巨大的，广大的；无边无际的；非常好的

satisfy.英释: to make someone feel pleased by doing what they want

battery.英释: an object that provides a supply of electricity for something such as a radio, car, or toy

carrion.英释: the decaying flesh of dead animals, which is eaten by some animals and birds

pervert.中释: 堕落者；行为反常者；性欲反常者；变态
pervert.英释: someone whose sexual behaviour is considered unnatural and unacceptable

almanac.英释: a book produced each year containing information about a particular subject, especially a sport, or important dates, times etc

comical.英释: behaviour or situations that are comical are funny in a strange or unexpected way

dignity.英释: the ability to behave in a calm controlled way even in a difficult situation

buoyant.中释: 轻快的；有浮力的；上涨的
buoyant.英释: buoyant prices etc tend to rise

ailment.英释: an illness that is not very serious

asinine.中释: 驴的；愚蠢的，固执的；驴子似的

stellar.中释: 星的；星球的；主要的；一流的

sinuous.英释: with many smooth twists and turns

interim.中释: 过渡时期，中间时期；暂定
interim.英释: in the period of time between two events

gestate.英释: to carry (developing young) in the uterus during pregnancy

enforce.英释: to make people obey a rule or law

redress.英释: money that someone pays you because they have caused you harm or damaged your property

depress.英释: to make someone feel very unhappy

angelic.中释: 天使的；似天使的；天国的
angelic.英释: looking good, kind, and gentle or behaving in this way

copious.英释: existing or being produced in large quantities

abusive.英释: using cruel words or physical violence

verbose.英释: using or containing too many words

endorse.中释: 背书；认可；签署；赞同；在背面签名
endorse.英释: to express formal support or approval for someone or something

inertia.中释: [力] 惯性；惰性，迟钝；不活动
inertia.英释: when no one wants to do anything to change a situation

wrangle.英释: to argue with someone angrily for a long time

portent.中释: 前兆；预示；迹象；异常之物
portent.英释: a sign or warning that something is going to happen

product.中释: 产品；结果；[数] 乘积；作品
product.英释: something that is grown or made in a factory in large quantities, usually in order to be sold

archive.英释: to put documents, books, information etc in an archive

insipid.英释: food or drink that is insipid does not have much taste

palette.英释: a thin curved board that an artist uses to mix paints, holding it by putting his or her thumb through a hole at the edge

deplete.中释: 耗尽，用尽；使衰竭，使空虚
deplete.英释: To deplete a stock or amount of something means to reduce it

stature.中释: 身高，身材；（精神、道德等的）高度

insight.英释: the ability to understand and realize what people or situations are really like

statute.英释: a law passed by a parliament, council etc and formally written down

respite.中释: 使缓解；使暂缓；使延期；缓期执行

bristle.英释: to behave in a way that shows you are very angry or annoyed

appease.中释: 使平息；使满足；使和缓；对…让步
appease.英释: If you try to appease someone, you try to stop them from being angry by giving them what they want

shrivel.英释: if something shrivels, or if it is shrivelled, it becomes smaller and its surface becomes covered in lines because it is very dry or old

noxious.中释: 有害的；有毒的；败坏道德的；讨厌的

concoct.中释: 捏造；混合而制；调合；图谋
concoct.英释: to invent a clever story, excuse, or plan, especially in order to deceive someone

octagon.英释: a flat shape with eight sides and eight angles

fatuous.中释: 愚笨的；昏庸的；发呆的；自满的

archaic.中释: 古代的；陈旧的；古体的；古色古香的

liberty.英释: the freedom and the right to do whatever you want without asking permission or being afraid of authority

atheism.英释: the belief that God does not exist

forceps.英释: a medical instrument used for picking up and holding things

analogy.英释: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

dilemma.中释: 困境；进退两难；两刀论法
dilemma.英释: a situation in which it is very difficult to decide what to do, because all the choices seem equally good or equally bad

burgher.中释: 市民（现主要指某些欧洲国家中产阶级的市民或镇民）；公民
burgher.英释: someone who lives in a particular town

expanse.中释: 宽阔；广阔的区域；苍天；膨胀扩张
expanse.英释: a very large area of water, sky, land etc

clarify.英释: to make something clearer or easier to understand

polymer.英释: a chemical  compound  that has a simple structure of large  molecule s

occlude.英释: to block or stop up (a passage or opening); obstruct

contact.英释: to write to or telephone someone

typical.中释: 典型的；特有的；象征性的
typical.英释: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

outrage.中释: 凌辱，强奸；对…施暴行；激起愤怒
outrage.英释: to make someone feel very angry and shocked

acquire.英释: to obtain something by buying it or being given it

carouse.中释: 喧闹的酒会或宴会；一饮而尽

garnish.中释: 为增加色香味而添加的配菜；装饰品
garnish.英释: a small amount of food such as salad or fruit that you place on food to decorate it

refusal.中释: 拒绝；优先取舍权；推却；取舍权
refusal.英释: when you say firmly that you will not do, give, or accept something

tyranny.中释: 暴政；专横；严酷；残暴的行为（需用复数）
tyranny.英释: cruel or unfair control over other people

epicure.中释: 老饕；美食家；享乐主义者
epicure.英释: someone who enjoys good food and drink

osmosis.中释: [物] 渗透；[物] 渗透性；渗透作用
osmosis.英释: the gradual process of liquid passing through a membrane

puerile.中释: 幼稚的；孩子气的；未成熟的；天真的

grimace.英释: an expression you make by twisting your face because you do not like something or because you are feeling pain

actuary.中释: [保险] 保险计算员；保险精算师
actuary.英释: someone whose job is to advise insurance companies on how much to charge for insurance, after calculating the risks

paradox.中释: 悖论，反论；似非而是的论点；自相矛盾的人或事
paradox.英释: a situation that seems strange because it involves two ideas or qualities that are very different

caprice.中释: 任性，反复无常；随想曲，怪想
caprice.英释: a sudden and unreasonable change of mind or behaviour

justify.英释: To justify a decision, action, or idea means to show or prove that it is reasonable or necessary

distill.英释: to make a liquid such as water or alcohol more pure by heating it so that it becomes a gas and then letting it cool. Drinks such as  whisky  are made this way.

expiate.英释: If you expiate guilty feelings or bad behaviour, you do something to indicate that you are sorry for what you have done

aquatic.中释: 水上运动；水生植物或动物

predict.英释: to say that something will happen, before it happens

abstain.英释: If you abstain during a vote, you do not use your vote

execute.英释: to kill someone, especially legally as a punishment

actuate.中释: 开动（机器等）；促使，驱使；激励（人等）
actuate.英释: to make a piece of machinery start to operate

malaise.英释: Malaise is a state in which people feel dissatisfied or unhappy but feel unable to change, usually because they do not know what is wrong

sensual.中释: 感觉的；肉欲的；世俗的；感觉论的

prickle.中释: 针一般地刺；戳；使感到刺痛
prickle.英释: if something prickles your skin, it makes it sting slightly

diverse.中释: 不同的；多种多样的；变化多的
diverse.英释: If a group of things is diverse, it is made up of a wide variety of things

miserly.英释: a miserly person is not generous and does not like spending money

bonanza.中释: 富矿带；带来好运之事；幸运
bonanza.英释: You can refer to a sudden great increase in wealth, success, or luck as a bonanza

faction.中释: 派别；内讧；小集团；纪实小说
faction.英释: a small group of people within a larger group, who have different ideas from the other members, and who try to get their own ideas accepted

vacuity.中释: 空虚；空白；思想贫乏；无聊之事
vacuity.英释: lack of intelligent, interesting, or serious thought

unknown.中释: 未知数；未知的事物，默默无闻的人
unknown.英释: things that you do not know or understand

squelch.中释: 噪声控制；嘎吱声；压倒对方的反驳；压碎的一堆

proverb.中释: 谚语，格言；众所周知的人或事
proverb.英释: a short well-known statement that gives advice or expresses something that is generally true. ‘A penny saved is a penny earned’ is an example of a proverb.

proceed.英释: The proceeds of an event or activity are the money that has been obtained from it

obscure.中释: 某种模糊的或不清楚的东西

scanner.中释: [计] 扫描仪；扫描器；光电子扫描装置
scanner.英释: a machine that passes an electrical beam over something in order to produce a picture of what is inside it

doleful.中释: 寂寞的；悲哀的；阴沉的；忧郁的

attache.中释: 专员，公使；使馆随员；大使馆专员

larceny.英释: the act or crime of stealing

perusal.英释: Perusal of something such as a letter, article, or document is the action of reading it

anxious.中释: 焦虑的；担忧的；渴望的；急切的

oxidize.英释: to combine with oxygen, or make something combine with oxygen, especially in a way that causes rust

affront.英释: a remark or action that offends or insults someone

pensive.中释: 沉思的，忧郁的；悲伤的，哀愁的
pensive.英释: thinking a lot about something, especially because you are worried or sad

ascribe.英释: If you ascribe an event or condition to a particular cause, you say or consider that it was caused by that thing

arduous.英释: involving a lot of strength and effort

abridge.英释: to reduce the length of (a written work) by condensing or rewriting

dubious.中释: 可疑的；暧昧的；无把握的；半信半疑的
dubious.英释: probably not honest, true, right etc

purloin.英释: to obtain something without permission – often used humorously

borough.英释: a town, or part of a large city, that is responsible for managing its own schools, hospitals, roads etc

perform.英释: to do something, especially something difficult or useful

voluble.中释: 健谈的；缠绕的；易旋转的
voluble.英释: If you say that someone is voluble, you mean that they talk a lot with great energy and enthusiasm

ensnare.中释: 诱捕；诱入陷阱；进入罗网
ensnare.英释: If an animal is ensnared, it is caught in a trap

clarity.英释: the clarity of a piece of writing, law, argument etc is its quality of being expressed clearly

pretend.英释: imaginary or not real - used especially by children

avarice.英释: a desire to have a lot of money that is considered to be too strong

benison.英释: a blessing, esp a spoken one

homonym.中释: 同音异义词；同形异义词；同形同音异义词；同名异物
homonym.英释: a word that is spelled the same and sounds the same as another, but is different in meaning or origin. For example, the noun ‘bear’ and the verb ‘bear’ are homonyms.

engross.中释: 使全神贯注；用大字体书写；正式写成（决议等）；独占；吸引
engross.英释: if something engrosses you, it interests you so much that you do not notice anything else

physics.英释: the science concerned with the study of physical objects and substances, and of natural forces such as light, heat, and movement

quibble.中释: 诡辩；挑剔；说模棱两可的话
quibble.英释: When people quibble over a small matter, they argue about it even though it is not important

readily.中释: 容易地；乐意地；无困难地

shuffle.中释: 洗牌，洗纸牌；混乱，蒙混；拖着脚走
shuffle.英释: a slow walk in which you do not lift your feet off the ground

arraign.英释: to make someone come to court to hear what their crime is

buffoon.英释: someone who does silly amusing things

elevate.中释: 提升；举起；振奋情绪等；提升…的职位
elevate.英释: to move someone or something to a more important level or rank, or make them better than before

procure.英释: to obtain something, especially something that is difficult to get

commute.英释: A commute is the journey that you make when you commute

isotope.英释: one of the possible different forms of an atom of a particular  element

generic.中释: 类的；一般的；属的；非商标的
generic.英释: relating to a whole group of things rather than to one thing

obesity.英释: when someone is very fat in a way that is unhealthy

rhombus.英释: a shape with four equal straight sides, especially one that is not a square

plunder.英释: to steal large amounts of money or property from somewhere, especially while fighting in a war

lobster.英释: a sea animal with eight legs, a shell, and two large claws

decimal.英释: a  fraction (= a number less than 1 )  that is shown as a  full stop  followed by the number of  tenth s  ,  hundredth s  etc. The numbers 0.5, 0.175, and 0.661 are decimals.

surpass.中释: 超越；胜过，优于；非…所能办到或理解
surpass.英释: to be even better or greater than someone or something else

brazier.英释: a metal container that holds a fire and is used to keep people warm outside

bullock.英释: a young male cow that cannot breed

missile.中释: 导弹的；可投掷的；用以发射导弹的

placate.英释: to make someone stop feeling angry

exigent.英释: demanding a lot of attention from other people in a way that is unreasonable

imprint.英释: When something is imprinted on your memory, it is firmly fixed in your memory so that you will not forget it

apology.中释: 道歉；谢罪；辩护；勉强的替代物
apology.英释: something that you say or write to show that you are sorry for doing something wrong

mawkish.中释: 令人作呕的，令人厌恶的；自作多情的；淡而无味的
mawkish.英释: showing too much emotion in a way that is embarrassing

imperil.英释: to put something or someone in danger

amnesia.中释: 健忘症，[内科] 记忆缺失
amnesia.英释: the medical condition of not being able to remember anything

cantata.中释: 大合唱；（意）清唱剧；康塔塔（一种声乐套曲）
cantata.英释: a piece of religious music for singers and instruments

provoke.英释: to cause a reaction or feeling, especially a sudden one

lactose.英释: a type of sugar found in milk, sometimes used as a food for babies and sick people

arbiter.英释: someone or something that settles an argument between two opposing sides

meander.英释: to walk somewhere in a slow relaxed way rather than take the most direct way possible

tenable.中释: （主张等）站得住脚的；可维持的
tenable.英释: a belief, argument etc that is tenable is reasonable and can be defended successfully

haughty.英释: behaving in a proud unfriendly way

beseech.中释: 恳求，哀求；乞求，急切地要求得到
beseech.英释: to eagerly and anxiously ask someone for something

abandon.英释: to leave someone, especially someone you are responsible for

recline.英释: to lie or lean back in a relaxed way

cadaver.英释: a dead human body, especially one used for study

variant.英释: something that is slightly different from the usual form of something

radical.中释: 基础；激进分子；[物化] 原子团；[数] 根数

biology.中释: （一个地区全部的）生物；生物学
biology.英释: the scientific study of living things

ammonia.英释: a clear liquid with a strong bad smell that is used for cleaning or in cleaning products

seclude.英释: to remove from contact with others

plummet.中释: 垂直落下；（价格、水平等）骤然下跌
plummet.英释: to suddenly and quickly decrease in value or amount

earnest.英释: if something starts happening in earnest, it begins properly – used when it was happening in a small or informal way before

network.英释: a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other

solvent.英释: a chemical that is used to  dissolve  another substance

blemish.英释: to spoil the beauty or appearance of something, so that it is not perfect

contort.英释: if you contort something, or if it contorts, it twists out of its normal shape and looks strange or unattractive

languid.中释: 倦怠的；呆滞的；软弱无力的

cynical.英释: unwilling to believe that people have good, honest, or sincere reasons for doing something

glacial.中释: 冰的；冰冷的；冰河时代的
glacial.英释: relating to ice and glaciers, or formed by glaciers

possess.中释: 控制；使掌握；持有；迷住；拥有，具备
possess.英释: to have a particular quality or ability

requite.英释: to give or do something in return for something done or given to you

glacier.英释: a large mass of ice which moves slowly down a mountain valley

passive.英释: the passive form of a verb, for example ‘was destroyed’ in the sentence ‘The building was destroyed during the war.’

forfeit.中释: （因犯罪、失职、违约等）丧失（权利、名誉、生命等）

onerous.中释: 繁重的；麻烦的；负有义务的；负有法律责任的
onerous.英释: work or a responsibility that is onerous is difficult and worrying or makes you tired

baleful.英释: expressing anger, hatred, or a wish to harm someone

boorish.中释: 粗野的；粗鲁的；粗鄙的；笨拙的；乡土气的
boorish.英释: Boorish behaviour is rough, uneducated, and rude

declaim.英释: to speak loudly, sometimes with actions, so that people notice you

anatomy.英释: the scientific study of the structure of human or animal bodies

inkling.中释: 暗示 （inkle的ing形式）；略知；低声说出

impasse.英释: a situation in which it is impossible to continue with a discussion or plan because the people involved cannot agree

algebra.英释: a type of mathematics that uses letters and other signs to represent numbers and values

decagon.中释: [数] 十角形；[数] 十边形

cardiac.中释: 心脏的；心脏病的；贲门的

affable.英释: friendly and easy to talk to

promote.英释: If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread

cryptic.中释: 神秘的，含义模糊的；[动] 隐藏的
cryptic.英释: having a meaning that is mysterious or not easily understood

cursory.英释: done very quickly without much attention to details

defraud.英释: to trick a person or organization in order to get money from them

genesis.英释: the beginning or origin of something

portray.英释: to describe or represent something or someone

neutral.中释: 中立国；中立者；非彩色；齿轮的空档
neutral.英释: a country, person, or group that is not involved in an argument or disagreement

liquefy.英释: to become liquid, or make something become liquid

censure.英释: the act of expressing strong disapproval and criticism

dullard.英释: someone who is stupid and has no imagination

utility.中释: 实用的；通用的；有多种用途的

qualify.中释: 限制；使具有资格；证明…合格
qualify.英释: to have the right to have or do something, or to give someone this right

blatant.中释: 喧嚣的；公然的；炫耀的；俗丽的
blatant.英释: something bad that is blatant is very clear and easy to see, but the person responsible for it does not seem embarrassed or ashamed

embargo.英释: an official order to stop trade with another country

derange.英释: to disturb the order or arrangement of; throw into disorder; disarrange

amiable.中释: (Amiable)人名；(法)阿米亚布勒；(英)阿米娅布尔

vitamin.中释: [生化] 维生素；[生化] 维他命
vitamin.英释: a chemical substance in food that is necessary for good health

thermal.英释: a rising current of warm air used by birds

redound.中释: 有助于；报偿，报应；被转移
redound.英释: If an action or situation redounds to your benefit or advantage, it gives people a good impression of you or brings you something that can improve your situation

privacy.英释: the state of being free from public attention

antenna.中释: [电讯] 天线；[动] 触角，[昆] 触须
antenna.英释: one of two long thin parts on an insect’s head, that it uses to feel things

virtual.中释: [计] 虚拟的；实质上的，事实上的（但未在名义上或正式获承认）
virtual.英释: made, done, seen etc on the Internet or on a computer, rather than in the real world

debacle.英释: an event or situation that is a complete failure

playful.中释: 开玩笑的；幽默的；爱嬉戏的
playful.英释: very active, happy, and wanting to have fun

macabre.中释: 可怕的；以死亡为主题的；令人毛骨悚然的（等于macaber）
macabre.英释: very strange and unpleasant and connected with death or with people being seriously hurt

fertile.中释: 富饶的，肥沃的；能生育的
fertile.英释: fertile land or soil is able to produce good crops

amenity.中释: 舒适；礼仪；愉快；便利设施
amenity.英释: something that makes a place comfortable or easy to live in

anomaly.英释: something that is noticeable because it is different from what is usual

auricle.英释: a small sac in the atrium of the heart

asexual.中释: [生物] 无性的；无性生殖的
asexual.英释: not having sexual organs or not involving sex

embroil.英释: to involve someone or something in a difficult situation

segment.英释: a part of something that is different from or affected differently from the whole in some way

empower.英释: to give a person or organization the legal right to do something

condemn.英释: to say very strongly that you do not approve of something or someone, especially because you think it is morally wrong

acerbic.中释: 尖刻的（等于acerb）；酸的；辛辣的
acerbic.英释: criticizing someone or something in a clever but cruel way

laconic.英释: using only a few words to say something

leaflet.英释: a small book or piece of paper advertising something or giving information on a particular subject

laggard.英释: someone or something that is very slow or late

vertigo.中释: 晕头转向，[临床] 眩晕
vertigo.英释: a feeling of sickness and dizziness caused by looking down from a high place

recruit.中释: 补充；聘用；征募；使…恢复健康

ignoble.中释: 不光彩的；卑鄙的；卑贱的
ignoble.英释: ignoble thoughts, feelings, or actions are ones that you should feel ashamed or embarrassed about

graphic.中释: 形象的；图表的；绘画似的
graphic.英释: connected with or including drawing, printing, or designing

lengthy.英释: continuing for a long time, often too long

license.英释: to give official permission for someone to do or produce something, or for an activity to take place

orifice.英释: one of the holes in your body, such as your mouth, nose etc

progeny.英释: the babies of animals or plants

synonym.英释: a word with the same meaning as another word in the same language

replica.英释: an exact copy of something, especially a building, a gun, or a work of art

devious.中释: 偏僻的；弯曲的；不光明正大的
devious.英释: not going in the most direct way to get to a place

neutron.英释: a part of an atom that has no electrical charge

acreage.英释: the area of a piece of land measured in acres

hirsute.中释: 多毛的；[昆] 有粗毛的
hirsute.英释: having a lot of hair on your body and face

inspire.中释: 激发；鼓舞；启示；产生；使生灵感
inspire.英释: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

reactor.中释: [化工] 反应器；[核] 反应堆；起反应的人

deficit.英释: the difference between the amount of something that you have and the higher amount that you need

jocular.中释: 爱开玩笑的；打趣的；滑稽的

setback.英释: a problem that delays or prevents progress, or makes things worse than they were

dwindle.英释: to gradually become less and less or smaller and smaller

slender.英释: thin in an attractive or graceful way

outcast.中释: 被遗弃的；无家可归的；被逐出的

logical.中释: 合逻辑的，合理的；逻辑学的

utilize.英释: to use something for a particular purpose

anarchy.中释: 无政府状态；混乱；无秩序
anarchy.英释: a situation in which there is no effective government in a country or no order in an organization or situation

antonym.英释: a word that means the opposite of another word

nurture.英释: the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes

explode.英释: to burst, or to make something burst, into small pieces, usually with a loud noise and in a way that causes damage

deceive.英释: to make someone believe something that is not true

unkempt.中释: 蓬乱的，不整洁的；（言语等）粗野的
unkempt.英释: unkempt hair or plants have not been cut and kept neat

convert.中释: 皈依者；改变宗教信仰者
convert.英释: someone who has been persuaded to change their beliefs and accept a particular religion or opinion

modicum.英释: a small amount of something, especially a good quality

beatify.英释: if the Pope beatifies someone, he says officially that they are a holy or special person

purport.英释: the general meaning of what someone says

regimen.中释: [医] 养生法；生活规则；政体；支配
regimen.英释: a special plan of food, exercise etc that is intended to improve your health

triumph.英释: to gain a victory or success after a difficult struggle

frantic.英释: extremely worried and frightened about a situation, so that you cannot control your feelings

conduit.英释: a pipe or passage through which water, gas, a set of electric wires etc passes

upbraid.英释: to tell someone angrily that they have done something wrong

senator.中释: 参议员；（古罗马的）元老院议员；评议员，理事
senator.英释: a member of the Senate or a senate

perjure.中释: 作伪证；使发伪誓；使破坏誓言
perjure.英释: to tell a lie after promising to tell the truth in a court of law

vestige.英释: a small part or amount of something that remains when most of it no longer exists

precede.英释: to happen or exist before something or someone, or to come before something else in a series

balance.英释: if a government balances the budget, they make the amount of money that they spend equal to the amount of money available

collide.英释: to hit something or someone that is moving in a different direction from you

squalid.英释: very dirty and unpleasant because of a lack of care or money

collier.英释: someone who works in a coal mine

abdomen.英释: the part of your body between your chest and legs which contains your stomach,  bowel s  etc

ruinous.中释: 破坏性的，毁灭性的；零落的
ruinous.英释: causing a lot of damage or problems

assuage.英释: to make an unpleasant feeling less painful or severe

pompous.中释: 自大的；浮夸的；华而不实的；爱炫耀的
pompous.英释: someone who is pompous thinks that they are important, and shows this by being very formal and using long words – used to show disapproval

theorem.英释: a statement, especially in mathematics, that you can prove by showing that it has been correctly developed from facts

impetus.英释: an influence that makes something happen or makes it happen more quickly

absolve.英释: to say publicly that someone is not guilty or responsible for something

bethink.中释: 想起，忆起；使……思考；使……考虑
bethink.英释: to cause (oneself) to consider or meditate

realism.中释: 现实主义；实在论；现实主义的态度和行为
realism.英释: the style of art and literature in which things, especially unpleasant things, are shown or described as they really are in life

outcome.英释: the final result of a meeting, discussion, war etc – used especially when no one knows what it will be until it actually happens

beguile.中释: 欺骗；使着迷；轻松地消磨
beguile.英释: to persuade or trick someone into doing something

amorous.中释: 多情的；恋爱的；热情的；色情的

overrun.英释: if unwanted things or people overrun a place, they spread over it in great numbers

dismiss.中释: 解散；解雇；开除；让离开；不予理会、不予考虑
dismiss.英释: to remove someone from their job

velvety.中释: 天鹅绒般柔软的；醇和的，可口的
velvety.英释: If you describe something as velvety, you mean that it is pleasantly soft to touch and has the appearance or quality of velvet

gravity.中释: 重力，地心引力；严重性；庄严
gravity.英释: the force that causes something to fall to the ground or to be attracted to another  planet

suspect.英释: to think that something is probably true, especially something bad

section.中释: 被切割成片；被分成部分
section.英释: If something is sectioned, it is divided into sections

summary.英释: a short statement that gives the main information about something, without giving all the details

chattel.英释: a piece of personal property that you can move from one place to another

comport.英释: to behave in a particular way

panacea.英释: If you say that something is a panacea for a set of problems, you mean that it will solve all those problems

cordial.中释: 补品；兴奋剂；甜香酒，甘露酒

contend.英释: to compete against someone in order to gain something

quietus.中释: 解除；偿清；生命的终止；寂灭

alleged.中释: 宣称（allege的过去式和过去分词）；断言

witness.英释: to see something happen, especially a crime or accident

presage.英释: to be a sign that something is going to happen, especially something bad

essence.英释: the most basic and important quality of something

oversee.中释: 监督；审查；俯瞰；偷看到，无意中看到
oversee.英释: to be in charge of a group of workers and check that a piece of work is done satisfactorily

emanate.中释: 放射（过去式emanated，过去分词emanated，现在分词emanating，第三人称单数emanates，形容词emanative）；发散
emanate.英释: If a quality emanates from you, or if you emanate a quality, you give people a strong sense that you have that quality

prosaic.中释: 平凡的，乏味的；散文体的

density.英释: the degree to which an area is filled with people or things

carcass.中释: （人或动物的）尸体；残骸；（除脏去头备食用的）畜体
carcass.英释: the body of a dead animal

pillory.中释: 示众；颈手枷；使惹人嘲笑
pillory.英释: a wooden frame with holes for someone’s head and hands to be locked into, used in the past as a way of publicly punishing someone

cholera.英释: a serious disease that causes sickness and sometimes death. It is caused by eating infected food or drinking infected water.

cadence.英释: the way someone’s voice rises and falls, especially when reading out loud

soluble.中释: [化学] 可溶的，可溶解的；可解决的
soluble.英释: a soluble substance can be  dissolved  in a liquid

awkward.中释: 尴尬的；笨拙的；棘手的；不合适的
awkward.英释: making you feel embarrassed so that you are not sure what to do or say

pipette.英释: to transfer or measure out (a liquid) using a pipette

brevity.英释: the quality of expressing something in very few words

contest.英释: a competition or a situation in which two or more people or groups are competing with each other

regnant.中释: 统治的；占优势的；流行的，广泛的

version.英释: a copy of something that has been changed so that it is slightly different

extrude.英释: to push or force something out through a hole

alchemy.英释: a science studied in the Middle Ages, that involved trying to change ordinary metals into gold

trigger.中释: 扳机；[电子] 触发器；制滑机
trigger.英释: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it

inveigh.英释: If you inveigh against something, you criticize it strongly

remorse.英释: a strong feeling of being sorry that you have done something very bad

context.英释: the situation, events, or information that are related to something and that help you to understand it

forgery.英释: a document, painting, or piece of paper money that has been copied illegally
